text: Tender lamb or beef slow-cooked underground with maguey leaves and spices. Served with handmade tortillas and salsa, it’s a festive dish that brings families together.
A unique tamal made with corn dough and wood ash, wrapped in leaves and steamed. Its earthy flavor and soft texture make it a traditional delicacy during local celebrations.
A warm, thick drink made from corn masa and ripe guava, sweetened with piloncillo. Comforting and aromatic, it’s a favorite during cool mountain mornings and festive gatherings.
